key_risks: Supply chain vulnerabilities due to reliance on global semiconductor supply chain
Intense market competition from firms like Qualcomm and Microchip Technology
Dependence on cyclical consumer electronics market
Regulatory risks including data privacy laws and export controls
Legal and financial penalties totaling $3.26 million since 2000
controversies: Recent litigation and case law updates on force majeure clauses
Ongoing legal issues such as Ali v. Synaptics Inc.
social_issues: Commitment to labor and human rights through Human Rights Policy
governance_issues: Insider Trading Policy with Special Black-Out Periods to prevent trading on material non-public information

sources.title: Case Law Update: Disputes Relating to Supply Chain Disruptions Hit the ...
sources.snippet: Over the last two years, the widespread shortages, stoppages, and other disruptions affecting much of the global supply chain have led manufacturers, suppliers, and buyers alike to examine their contract terms for an available excuse for nonperformance. Contract parties have focused in particular on any applicable force majeure clauses.
